Auckland mother of two young children devastated after freak cycling accident claims husband’s life at Stanley Point https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/our-rock-auckland-mother-of-two-young-children-devastated-after-freak-cycling-accident-claims-husbands-life/XR3NNQTRIJEXFOFKLQNHNAZVFA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/our-rock-auckland-mother-of-two-young-children-devastated-after-freak-cycling-accident-claims-husbands-life/XR3NNQTRIJEXFOFKLQNHNAZVFA/ Bernard OrsmanGemma Gordon has been widowed with two young children. Tue, 24 Dec 2024 05:07:35 +0000 Jack Gordon (right), who died following a cycling accident, with wife Gemma, Quinn, 4, and Mia, 6 months.
Prime Minister Christopher Luxon shares festive photo of family Christmas Eve tradition, donning matching pyjamas https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/prime-minister-christopher-luxon-shares-festive-photo-of-family-christmas-eve-tradition-donning-matching-pyjamas/AFHEZXXALZFKPJ26SREJSKLF4Q/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/prime-minister-christopher-luxon-shares-festive-photo-of-family-christmas-eve-tradition-donning-matching-pyjamas/AFHEZXXALZFKPJ26SREJSKLF4Q/ The Luxons' holiday movie of choice in the past has been the classic Love Actually. Tue, 24 Dec 2024 08:08:34 +0000 Prime Minister Christopher Luxon, wife Amanda and children Olivia and William wear matching festive pyjamas on Christmas Eve, carrying on one of their relatively recent family traditions. Photo / Supplied
Gang patch ban: Who are the Damned Pirates, Fitus and H-Town 07, subject to the new law? https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/gang-patch-ban-who-are-the-damned-pirates-fitus-and-h-town-07-subject-to-the-new-law/ L3LCATFPRZAIDOSF6BALIFO7PI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/gang-patch-ban-who-are-the-damned-pirates-fitus-and-h-town-07-subject-to-the-new-law/ L3LCATFPRZAIDOSF6BALIFO7PI/ George BlockPolice intel files reveal fresh details on little-known Kiwi gangs subject to new law. Mon, 23 Dec 2024 16:00:00 +0000 An image of the Fitus logo that appears in the police intelligence report on the gang. The "276" refers to the Otahuhu area code, as does "OtaBlue", with the blue referring to the colour favoured by the Crips and affiliated gangs - as does "We Steady Crippin'".
Tourism heavy hitters told Auckland Mayor Wayne his CCO reforms stood to lose $2m for major events https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/tourism-heavy-hitters-told-auckland-mayor-wayne-his-cco-reforms-stood-to-lose-2m-for-mayor-events/3JD56SYC7FFKRG4PG3OT3TS4GI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/tourism-heavy-hitters-told-auckland-mayor-wayne-his-cco-reforms-stood-to-lose-2m-for-mayor-events/3JD56SYC7FFKRG4PG3OT3TS4GI/ Bernard OrsmanThe mayor changed his plans after hearing from tourism bosses. Mon, 23 Dec 2024 16:00:00 +0000 The letter said Auckland destination marketing and major events could lose $2m of private funding. Photo / Alex Burton
Legislation, losers and lessons: Andrew Bayly’s 2024 https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/legislation-losers-and-lessons-andrew-baylys-2024/52UJGDXZH5GNXIMAZ6HELPG2F4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/legislation-losers-and-lessons-andrew-baylys-2024/52UJGDXZH5GNXIMAZ6HELPG2F4/ Tom RaynelMinister Andrew Bayly sat down with Tom Raynel to discuss his 2024, and what comes next. Mon, 23 Dec 2024 16:00:00 +0000 Minister Andrew Bayly has had a rollercoaster year, from legislative agenda progress to a ministerial visit blunder. He spoke with Tom Raynel about his year gone by, and what 2025 has in store. New Zealand Herald photograph by Mark Mitchell
